poem:
Unrest at the Convention

Among the city's cold steel,
banners rise,
fractured voices thunder
asking why
the land quakes with anguish—
mothers search eyes
for calm in the storm.
Unity trembles
under the shadow of broken ground,
where hope and despair
rally together,
unsure
which will win this march.
